analysis.rotation_analyzer.RotationAnalyzer¶

class analysis.rotation_analyzer.RotationAnalyzer(loader: Loader)¶

Bases: object

Methods

calculate_all_estimation_error_for_all

Calculate estimation errors for all subjects in the dataset.

calculate_estimation_error

Calculate the estimation error for a given subject and trial number.

calculate_estimation_error_for_one

Calculate estimation errors for a specific subject in the given range of trials.
calculate_all_estimation_error_for_all(start: int, end: int, excluding: Optional[List[str]] = None) → Dict[str, Dict[int, float]]¶

Calculate estimation errors for all subjects in the dataset.

Parameters:

  • start – The index of the first trial (inclusive).

  • end – The index of the last trial (exclusive).

  • excluding – A list of subject names to exclude from the calculation.

Returns:

A dictionary of estimation errors for each subject and trial.

Return type:

Dict[str, Dict[int, float]]

calculate_estimation_error(subject_name: str, trial_number: int) → Optional[float]¶

Calculate the estimation error for a given subject and trial number.

Parameters:

  • subject_name – The name of the subject.

  • trial_number – The trial number.

Returns:

The estimation error.

Return type:

float

calculate_estimation_error_for_one(subject_name: str, start: int = 3, end: int = 23) → Dict[int, float]¶

Calculate estimation errors for a specific subject in the given range of trials.

Parameters:

  • subject_name – The name of the subject.

  • start – The index of the first trial (inclusive).

  • end – The index of the last trial (exclusive).

Returns:

A dictionary of estimation errors for each trial.

Return type:

Dict[int, float]
